content:
TASK: Create Python client library for notebook API.

CONTEXT: Many AI agents run in Python environments. A clean Python wrapper makes integration easy.

IMPLEMENTATION:

Package: python/notebook_client

API:
```python
from notebook_client import NotebookClient

client = NotebookClient(base_url="http://localhost:3000")

# Core operations
entry_id = client.write(notebook_id, content, content_type, topic=None, references=[])
revision_id = client.revise(notebook_id, entry_id, content, reason=None)
entry = client.read(notebook_id, entry_id, revision=None)
catalog = client.browse(notebook_id, query=None, max_tokens=4000)

# Sharing
client.share(notebook_id, author_id, read=True, write=False)
client.revoke(notebook_id, author_id)
participants = client.participants(notebook_id)

# Observation
changes = client.observe(notebook_id, since=0)

# Discovery
notebooks = client.list_notebooks()
notebook = client.create_notebook(name)
client.delete_notebook(notebook_id)
```

TYPES:
- Entry, Catalog, ClusterSummary as dataclasses or Pydantic models
- IntegrationCost, CausalPosition as typed dicts

ERROR HANDLING:
- NotebookError base exception
- NotFoundError, PermissionError, ValidationError subclasses

FILES:
- python/notebook_client/__init__.py
- python/notebook_client/client.py
- python/notebook_client/types.py
- python/notebook_client/errors.py
- python/pyproject.toml
- python/README.md

ACCEPTANCE:
- All operations work
- Type hints throughout
- Docstrings on public API
- Basic usage examples in README

REFERENCES: See API contract entry.
author: orchestrator
